section.p: A constraint policy is intended to constrain an existing policy. For example a ConstraintPolicy instance may be used to represent a consent directive that sets specific 'constraints' on a default organizational policy regarding substance abuse data (e.g., 42CFR Part2). A policy (BasicPolicy or CompositePolicy) can be constrained in the sense of profiles for tailoring a policy instance. Complex constraints (e.g., an OCL expression) may be applied and managed separately. For this definition and management purpose it is possible to separate externally-defined constraints and specify a 'ConstraintPolicy' with clearly defined associations to the constrained policy according to component model principles. Effectively, the result of applying constraints is just another CompositePolicy.

ol.li:
Contains zero or more [0..*] constraint with data type String
Constraint expression.

Contains exactly one [1..1] description with data type String
This attribute specifies the narrative description of the policy.

Contains exactly one [1..1] effectiveTime with data type Time Interval
This attribute specifies the period of time (e.g., start date, end date) during which the privacy policy described by ePolicy is in effect.

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
Uniquely identifies the policy

Contains exactly one [1..1] name with data type String
A human discernible name for the policy

Contains exactly one [1..1] status with data type Code
This attribute indicates whether the policy is active or not

Contains exactly one [1..1] uri with data type String
The location of published policy.

Contains exactly one [1..1] purposeOfUse with data type Code
This attribute is used to specify the purpose to permit a specific type of action/operation according to the policy. The vocabulary analysis section provides additional illustrative values for the concept embodied by this attribute.

Contains zero or more [0..*] allowableAccessTime with data type Time Interval
An access may be allowed only during specific time periods of the day (e.g., 9 am to 5 pm).

Contains exactly one [1..1] route with data type Code
This attribute specifies whether access to protected information may only be granted for a specified route of access. For example, access may be restricted to remote users using a Virtual Private Network (VPN). The route is a context qualifier as specified by ISO/IEC 10164-9.

Contains zero or more [0..*] constraint with data type String
Constraint expression.

Contains zero or more [0..*] authority, where its type is Authority
This is an association to the Authority that issued the policy.

Contains zero or more [0..*] securityRole, where its type is Security Role
ISO-22600 specifies a role as 'set of competences and/or performances which is associated with a task'. A role is a specialization of CompositePolicy that define a group of policies (authorization, obligation, delegation and refrain policies).

Contains zero or more [0..*] operationType, where its type is Operation
This association refers to the operation associated with the policy.

Contains zero or more [0..*] informationReference, where its type is Information Reference
This association references the attributes of the information referenced in the policy.
